website_summaries.verdict: Many larger breeds respond well to "prey-style" raw meat blends like Merrick's Backcountry.
pros: Deboned beef is first ingredient, also contains lamb and rabbit
Salmon oil provides omega-3, as well as glucosamine and chondroitin to help with joint flexibility
cons: Some reports of bloating and overactive bladders after eating

customer_reviews.title: This is good quality dog food
customer_reviews.text: This is good quality dog food, but the bag that I received from Amazon had something wrong with it. My dog has been eating Merrick Back Country Raw Infused dog food for quite some time, but he wouldn't touch the food from this new bag. The dried pieces of meat in the bag looked super dry and crumbly. I bought another bag from my usual vendor, and he immediately ate it. I'm having to mail this back to Amazon and it should be thrown in the trash. Maybe it's old? I don't know, but it's a pain to have to ship back when if it was the usual quality, there would be no need.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara K. Hassman

customer_reviews.title: No raw pieces
customer_reviews.text: I’m annoyed. I buy this food specifically for the raw pieces. This bag came 1. ripped on the side but also 2. no raw pieces. There was 1. 1 dehydrated raw piece in the entire bag. If you want a consistent food with actual raw pieces, get wellness core raw rev. This dog food is not cheap so I find this ridiculous. We ordered a second back and THE SECOND BAG was also ripped. I opened the box and kibble went all over the floor
customer_reviews.author: nicole polsinelli

customer_reviews.title: Not the same quality as store bought
customer_reviews.text: This is not the same product you get when bought in the store. I am returning to Amazon as this is not the quality I expect from 65.00 bag of dog food. Photo on left is from Amazon. Photo on right is the same exact brand and flavor bought at Pet Smart. The amazon purchased kibble is dry and a little lighter in color. The meat pieces look old and more like wet OSB wood than freeze dried meat. Do NOT buy. Go to the store and pay the extra 5.00
customer_reviews.author: Tifanie T.

customer_reviews.title: I ordered this many times and was pleased. I opened my most recent order and the ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this many times and was pleased. I opened my most recent order and the freeze dried bits were missing - makes me think this isn't the real thing we're buying. I will gladly be going to my local pet store to purchase instead!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda H.

customer_reviews.title: It's like a bowl full of tasty treats!
customer_reviews.text: We have tried several different grain-free dog foods for our golden retriever who has food allergies. This is the only one that he RUNS to when we put it in his bowl! We have seen nice results in his itching and his coat has never looked healthier! It is pricey - the first time that we bought it, I wasn't sure that we would get it again, but now I can see that it is worth every penny! The Amazon price here is just a bit cheaper than at our local store, so I think we will just plan to order off Amazon from now on.
customer_reviews.author: 3 Boys Mum

customer_reviews.title: My pups who aren’t picky hated this flavor!!
customer_reviews.text: Very odd that 4 out of my 5 kids didn’t not really care for this. Two even refused to eat dinner that night. Shocking! I even had a clients dog come over who turned her nose up at it too. I feel that tells me a lot. We have bought a different type of this brand food before, the salmon and they did like that. Thinking it is just this flavor bc my kids have NEVER been picky. I was shocked!!! There were lots of the freeze dried chunks in it though. Guess worth the one star for that.
customer_reviews.author: Goldielocks

customer_reviews.title: Ripeoff.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I bought this food. When I opened the bag there were 4 little pieces of the freeze-dried food in the bag. My dog ate it anyway, but I will not be buying it again because of the freeze dried food is a very small amount. Do not buy it.they are a rip-off.
customer_reviews.author: ray1492

customer_reviews.title: Good brand and less mess for the raw diet
customer_reviews.text: Both dogs late and present love this specific flavor. The dehydrated nuggets are a big hit . Adds the good goods to your pets diet . I think it’s a little steep in price but the best things are worth it right. Why y’all keep asking about flavor i ain’t sitting here munching down 😂 I definitely love my babies but they don’t speak the same language . I don’t have picky eaters so flavor of anything that isn’t green beans hasn’t been a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Theo.B

customer_reviews.title: Life saver
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried wet food, dry food, a combination of the two, warmed it up, cooled it down..... so many different brands of dog food.... and this is the only food my dog will consistently eat. He loves it. He will dig around the bowl and eat all the raw bits first but he eats the kibble too. I’m so glad a friend recommended this food to me because I was feeling so helpless that my dog wouldn’t eat anything
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: always great. I left the lid off of the food ...
customer_reviews.text: always great. I left the lid off of the food container to let him take in fully the new bag experience. I left the room and forgot about it and returned to find Flick nearly spherical, having picked out many of the freeze dried pieces. He was done nuzzling through the 'other' kibble and sat, proudly, next to the conquest.
customer_reviews.author: Dann Farr

customer_reviews.title: Dog gained too much eating this
customer_reviews.text: We started giving our dog only the amount recommended. Then we gave her less food because she gained tons of weight. She is a very active dog and shouldn't have gained that much weight which tells me there is too much additives or fat with this brand. We switched to Hills Fit and Radiant. She's lost the pounds and is happy again! And, so are we!
customer_reviews.author: MrsP88

customer_reviews.title: Dog Loves This Food
customer_reviews.text: I used to feed Merrick Backcountry to my dog, until I found out that grain-free is bad for dogs, then I switched to Merrick Classic. My dog loved the freeze-dried pieces in the Backcountry, so I was excited when they came out with this food. (Backcountry With Grains). I switched my dog back to this food (with the grains), and again he loves his food.
customer_reviews.author: PiedPiper

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS!! My dogs were reluctant to eat this food and after going through almost the entire 12 pound bag I found mold at the bottom! I was recommended this food by Castor & Pollux customer service after they discontinued the food I had been feeding my dogs, which they said this food is comparable. After reading reviews on this product it all makes sense now. Purina now owns Merricks and Castor and Pollux. It’s clear the quality food we were once getting is no more thanks to Purina. Time to find new food.
customer_reviews.author: Sheridan Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: Something's different...
customer_reviews.text: I fed my dog this food for about a year. I used to buy it at the pet store but switched to Amazon for convenience. My dog had several gastrointestinal issues when I started getting it from Amazon. The food was visually different--more dried out perhaps. Hard to be certain what the issue is (Merrick was acquired by Purina; Amazon doesn't store/handle it properly; maybe something with my dog) but I stopped getting this food because of pretty dramatic stomach issues that cleared up when I switched to another brand I bought at the local pet store.
customer_reviews.author: VTMTKY

customer_reviews.title: This food is awesome.
customer_reviews.text: We've been serving this food for about 3 weeks. My two senior Jack Russells are acting like puppies again. So much energy and playfulness. So alert too. AND they have solid poops everyday. My only complaint is that i didn't find this food much sooner!! My dogs have a new lease on life.
customer_reviews.author: carlos

customer_reviews.title: Where have the raw infused pieces gone?
customer_reviews.text: I used to give this 5 stars, but the last two bags were a little light on the raw infused pieces. That's why I buy this dog food. I have a dog that is allergic to chicken and this food has helped her coat and skin get back to normal. But I can buy non-chicken dog food elsewhere, it's the raw pieces that I give as treats to the dogs. This is the last bag I will purchase if I feel like I'm being ripped off!
customer_reviews.author: Shelley Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Dog Food
customer_reviews.text: Fur face really like this food when I first bought it and it had a lot of chunks of white, freeze dried meat. Subsequent bags had crumbs of the white meat but no visible chunks. By the end of the bag though, she quit eating it eagerly, would then eat it when she was starving and then I had to give it to the neighbor and by different, less expensive food (also by Merrick) that she would eat.
customer_reviews.author: Tuckendorf

customer_reviews.title: Finally..A dry my dog will eat
customer_reviews.text: I tried every expensive dry with my lab. At first I mixed wet in but he would lick it off the dry. I even cooked for him. Picky. Finally I stopped and just gave dry but he would go days without eating and was starting to lose weight. Then I saw this food and though..well..he loves the freeze dried treats so maybe he will eat this. He does...he picks the raw bites out later, then usually comes back later for the rest but unlike all the other dries he will eat a good size bowl at least a day and he is slowly putting a tiny bit of weight on.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Henwood

customer_reviews.title: Nutritional but not my dogs favorite
customer_reviews.text: this product has very good reviews on professional dog food review sites for it's nutritional ingredients. I've been purchasing this product for several years now and have noticed the freeze dried raw chunks have gone down in quantity over the years. It is not my dogs favorite food which is why I mix it with one or two other top rated dog foods on a regular basis.
customer_reviews.author: W. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Good quality most of the time
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying this dog food for a year now. During this time I have only had a problem with one bag (out of 10 bags). I contacted Merrick right away and they asked for the manufacturing information and sent me a coupon for a free bag. I buy the 22 lb. bag and that's the size they gave me. My dog has always loved this food, with the exception of this one bag. Hopefully the quality will not be a problem in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Gombert

customer_reviews.title: Bag arrived damaged and open.
customer_reviews.text: I was exceptionally skeptical about dog food from Amazon and reading other reviews didn't really ameliorate that skepticism. Nevertheless, I figured I'd give it a shot. I regret having done so. The bag arrived with a large hole in the side and food spilling out. I wouldn't eat food from an open container and I won't feed it to my dogs, either. Of course, now I have the hassle of returning a 22-pound bag of food.
customer_reviews.author: DeeJay

customer_reviews.title: I was worried that they might not like it since they are picky little chihuahuas
customer_reviews.text: We've been feeding our dogs Merrick dry foods for a few years, but this is the first time we've tried the BackCountry blend. I was worried that they might not like it since they are picky little chihuahuas. To my surprise, they gobbled it up the first time without any other mixes. We usually blend Paul Newman's canned and SoJos for a well-balanced meal, but this can be costly. Now, I have hopes they will continue to enjoy this blend without all the other additions. I highly recommend any of the Merrick brands.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: They don't feel good.
customer_reviews.text: Both of my dogs developed I intestinal problems. I searched for the cause and after awhile I thought it was an adjustment period to a "higher" quality food. Their stools became firmer, but not normal. They don't feel good.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Lewis

customer_reviews.title: though the Merrick brand is great. We found that our very active dog is ...
customer_reviews.text: We have two dogs. And in an ideal world both our pups would be on Merrick but our Lab/Plott Hound mix has a very sensitive stomach. But that doesn't stop our 6 year old Boxer Pointer mix. HE LOVES IT! The Backcountry brand has done wonders, though the Merrick brand is great. We found that our very active dog is much better with the Backcountry blend. If you have bigger dogs I highly recommend this blend!
customer_reviews.author: Living That Dog Life

customer_reviews.title: EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED FOR THE PRICE MERRICK
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd Bag that I have ordered and there is only ONE PIECE OF RAW FREEZE DRIED IN THE WHOLE BAG. EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED FOR THE PRICE MERRICK CHARGES
customer_reviews.author: Laurie B.

customer_reviews.title: Great food
customer_reviews.text: Dogs love this food, mostly for the raw dried bits in bag. Pricey but worth it. Minpin has delicate system and he has done well. Like their dried raw only bags but a little more pricey than other brands of same.will continue with this bagged dry food, better than Instinct similar dry food option
customer_reviews.author: WI shopper

customer_reviews.title: Made My Dog Sick
customer_reviews.text: Just trying to transition from my dog's old food to this made him sick for days. I've fed him other varieties of Merrick before without any problems, but this version doesn't sit well with my dog at all.
customer_reviews.author: figmund

customer_reviews.title: Little dogs like it!
customer_reviews.text: I started with the smaller bag, I think it was 4 lbs, because my silky terrier is so picky. I also have a papillon which seems indifferent. She doesn't like any dry food . But I think I scored big with Merrick because of the dried chicken bits in it. It seems like when I bought my second bag, 12 lbs, the chicken bits were bigger, which the papillon loved. So I am very happy knowing that it's grain free and packed with nutrients. Happy dogs, happy mom.
customer_reviews.author: Sweetcolorado

customer_reviews.title: and some of the people who I know research the best diet for their pooches all agreed on Merrick brand
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this for my dogs. Now my dogs shuffle through grain free brands, because each month it's a different person buying it. My brother buys blue buffalo and my parents go for natural balance. Now I work at a doggie daycare and boarding place, and some of the people who I know research the best diet for their pooches all agreed on Merrick brand. So I bought and and put it down because we let our dogs graze. They cleared out the bowls they were so pleased, and my dogs are picky as picky can get. I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: scarlet

customer_reviews.title: Best dog food we have found!
customer_reviews.text: Best dog food ever! It has freeze dried morsels with the dog Food pellets. I give my dog a freeze dried meat treat out of the bag every morning. My dog now sticks to me like glue just in case she might get another freeze dried morsel. Also the food is very healthy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves it.
customer_reviews.text: My 13 lb. rat terrier is crazy for this dog food. I had been loyal to Iams for about 3 years but my dog has begun to develop skin allergies. So I am trying a more natural raw type diet. I am unable to afford a fresh completely raw diet so I am trying this all meat no grains. I will update in a few weeks to let you know if improved. But so far the flavor is a big hit.
customer_reviews.author: Old Coast Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shorkie loves this dog food
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Shorkie (Yorkie/Shi-tsu mix). He loves it so far. I was a bit skeptic to order after reading reviews from some that there was no raw bits in theirs. Fortunately, the bag I received has plenty of raw chunks included. That's his favorite part but he also loves the kibble part. He picks out the raw bits then eats the kibble so I'm good with that. I think this is a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: O. Ranney

customer_reviews.title: all of our dogs will eat this
customer_reviews.text: Well, I think it tastes awful, but our dogs will all eat it. The male cocker isn't fussy so his opinion doesn't matter and the shih tzu eats goose poop so make what you want out of that, but the female cocker is fussy as a cat and she eats it. They love the freeze-dried chunks and eat those first, but while they're there, they'll eventually eat the kibble. It's good by itself or mixed w/ some shredded cheese or ground turkey too.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Jovinelli

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love it, maybe too much:)
customer_reviews.text: Now both my dogs really enjoy this food. I bought it for something different for them, the only problem is my greedy smaller dog stands there eating till shes picked out all the freeze dried bits lol. So I have to pick them all out and give it to them as treats so my other dog can actually get some. There were more freeze dried bits than I expected in it, great choice!
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Very limited amount of raw food inside
customer_reviews.text: At first we loved this food for our lab and she really enjoyed it. Great ingredients and at first look there was a lot of raw mixed in. However, once we were about a third of the way through the bag there was a noticeable decrease in raw to kibble ratio to the point where we would be lucky to have a single freeze dried raw piece in her bowl for the last half of the bag. Very disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: This prod on Amazon is not the same as from the pet store that looks the same.
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed that the same packaging for both items is essentially the same; which led to an ordering mistake. Pet does not like the Red meat recipe Beef. But loves the freeze dried version. No rebate available!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joanell O'Connell

customer_reviews.title: this dog food is a very good choice. Ingredients are rather straight-up compared to some ...
customer_reviews.text: First off, I need to clarify we make our own dog food, have been for years. But we do believe in adding a very small amount of well made dry kibble to our food. That being said, this dog food is a very good choice. Ingredients are rather straight-up compared to some of the other products out there that should not be fed to any dog, period. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: thinkaboutit

customer_reviews.title: Excellent food for bulldogs!
customer_reviews.text: This is really great food. I have an English and a French Bulldog. Bulldogs often have food allergies - especially with foods containing chicken. The fact that this is a high-quality food, there's no chicken, high in protein, and its grain-free makes this a HUGE win for bulldogs (and other breeds). I've used MANY of the other "top-priced" brands and this is my favorite by far.
customer_reviews.author: HuntsDesk

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves it, but the bags are smaller and more expensive than Merrick's other foods
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this food! I wish it wasn't more expensive and a smaller size bag than their other foods though. My dog is a husky/lab mix puppy who is growing like a weed. I thought that we went through the larger bags of food quickly, but since this bag is smaller we have to buy it more often. We're actually thinking about switching him back to the other Merrick grain-free food because they're sold in larger bags and it's cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Steven R. Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Happy with ingredients
customer_reviews.text: I normally use a different food for my babies but it's a canadian food so it's sometimes hard to get down here in GA. This Backcountry line seems to be the closest food I've found to our preferred brand/line of food and it's close to the same price range. It works great as a backup when we need.
customer_reviews.author: Heaven Leigh

customer_reviews.title: ... did some research on this product and it had good reviews and a website that looks at ingredients in ...
customer_reviews.text: I did some research on this product and it had good reviews and a website that looks at ingredients in dog food gave it a high rating, however when I fed this to my dog she developed hemorrhagic gastroenteritis after slowly switching her to this food. Not that this would happen to all dogs but it happened to mine.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas V. Motto

customer_reviews.title: and hes always loved it. I thought since this was a new ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been feeding my dog regular merrick grain free food since I've had him, and hes always loved it. I thought since this was a new product I'd like to try it out to give him some variety.. however, he was pretty picky this time around and will not finish all of the food in his bowl now.. i can tell he doesnt like this one as much as the chicken and sweet potato which we will be going back to.. another picky eater!
customer_reviews.author: evan2293

customer_reviews.title: This is definitely my dog's favorite food. He's a very picky BT who loves ...
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely my dog's favorite food. He's a very picky BT who loves having extras such as chicken, veggies, and eggs in his food but sometimes I just don't have the time to add things. He loves the little real pieces of meat because it makes him feel like it's not boring old kibble.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I’m very picky about pet food.. I’m satisfied with Merrick. My dogs love the rawbits. The ingredients speak for themselves when it comes to this product. You’re buying real, quality ingredients. No junk.
customer_reviews.author: Kalee

customer_reviews.title: MORE FREEZE DRIED CHUNKS PLEASE!!
customer_reviews.text: 95% kibble, 5% freeze dried... I’ve been a monthly delivery subscription member for about a year and have noticed a steady decline in the amount freeze dried chunks they put in the food... this last bag was so minimal that I literally have to search for them!! I understand that this is the most expensive part of the production of the food, but when I’m paying top dollar for quality food, I expect quality!!
customer_reviews.author: Chad Pavcovich

customer_reviews.title: My large breed puppy loves this food! I have ...
customer_reviews.text: My large breed puppy loves this food! I have had her on puppy chow then to Purina one and she had severe allergies. From there I put her on Merrick limited ingredient and her allergies subsided but she was not the biggest fan of the food. I switched her to Merrick backcountry and her bowl is always empty! She loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Karley

customer_reviews.title: My Pug's favorite food
customer_reviews.text: Started using this when vet told us we needed to give our Pug Glucosamine...the expensive treats made him vomit, but when I tried Backcountry red label, he loved it, and we started noticing a difference in his back legs, so it definitely helped! I've tried others since, but we always end up back with Merrick Backcountry
customer_reviews.author: Nancy T

customer_reviews.title: super picky eater loves this food
customer_reviews.text: my super picky dog LOVES this food. she is the pickiest eater, will literally not eat food she doesn't like, she gobbles this up. She goes for the freeze dried meat pieces first and then eats the rest of the food throughout the day. She is the pickiest eater and loves this food so it's got to be good.
customer_reviews.author: ss.lee

customer_reviews.title: My dog eats it and has vitality and solid poops. What more do you want?
customer_reviews.text: I don't like the taste of it but my dog does. I'm not sure if the extra cost for the freestride meat parts are worth it but I don't want to sweat a few dollars if it's better for my dog
customer_reviews.author: Michael W

customer_reviews.title: Happy dog owner.
customer_reviews.text: I love the quality and price. My dog loves the flavor. Meat.
customer_reviews.author: Lester

customer_reviews.title: Good ingredients
customer_reviews.text: My four year old Labrador seems to love, it. To be fair, labs love any food. Has all the ingredients that you would want for your “best friend”. I’d highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Olsen

customer_reviews.title: only 2 pieces of the freeze dried meat
customer_reviews.text: The last 4 pound bag I purchased had only 2 pieces of the freeze dried meat!! Normally I would give this product 5 stars, as my dogs love it and it's great for the allergic one.
customer_reviews.author: S. Pyle

customer_reviews.title: Too Much Powdered
customer_reviews.text: I cannot explain why my dog doesn't care for the food -- perhaps it's simply not to his taste -- but the fact that there is so great a ratio of kibble-dust to solid kibble, so he'd need to lick it up rather than bite and chew it, seems problematic to me.
customer_reviews.author: Conrad Risher

customer_reviews.title: New Recipe or Bad Batch?
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if they changed the recipe or if I got a bad batch this time. I have bought this product several times before, but this bag seemed to have about 90% LESS freeze dried meat as the previous ones I've purchased. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: BH

customer_reviews.title: High quality food
customer_reviews.text: My tiny terror mix LOVES this food. She is not a picky eater anyway, and she has consumed most of a large bag without complaint. Her stools are consistent and firm, and she has had no digestive problems. I don't supplement with anything except vegetables, fruit and nuts that I use as treats.
customer_reviews.author: SKR

customer_reviews.title: Gave my pup bad gas and the runs
customer_reviews.text: My sensitive english bulldog puppy had awful smelling gas and runs on this food. We transitioned her slowly into this food and gave it a good month before deciding to take her off it. She never complains about food, but she wasn't as excited about mealtime as on other brands like Canidae and TOTW.
customer_reviews.author: Tjendol

customer_reviews.title: Great food, costly.
customer_reviews.text: I trust the Merrick brand and I have been using it on and off during the lifetime of my two dogs aged 14 and 15. This new freeze-dried food is terrific and they gobbled it right up. I will use this occasionally to liven up their food, but the price is prohibitive and won't allow me to use it on a regular basis.
customer_reviews.author: S WILLIAMS

customer_reviews.title: Great quality food at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves it and the ingredients are super high quality. In addition, my dog's hair now has that silky feeling that comes with eating quality food. I found that this was a great product at an affordable price. My dog weighs about 40 lbs and I only feed him 1 cup of food per day.
customer_reviews.author: Ponkow

customer_reviews.title: My dogs LOVE this stuff
customer_reviews.text: My dogs LOVE this stuff. The bags come with a ton of those little freeze dried bits, which are really expensive on their own so I feel like this is a great price. My puppy always picks the freeze-dried bits out first which is pretty entertaining to watch. The ingredients are really clean as well which is a huge plus and the main reason I buy Merrick.
customer_reviews.author: H. Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: We switched from blue buffalo. For only a couple dollars more this food is higher in protien. Our one dog has no poop issues the other one had some softer than normal stool to begin with but its seemed to even out now. and they both gobble down food... previously our one dog would just graze but now he eats his his breakfast and dinner.
customer_reviews.author: Destinee Z

customer_reviews.title: Nice and wholesome food for the fur babies.
customer_reviews.text: Great product and my two dogs ate the kibbles and freeze dried meat with ease and delight. My only wish is for this to be a dollar or two less. It gets quite expensive over time. So, in the meantime, it's an infrequent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Vi

customer_reviews.title: Texas Made. The Best Ingredients fromthe USA.
customer_reviews.text: One of the best dog foods there is. All USA sourced meats and vegetables. All of my dogs love it.
customer_reviews.author: nom de guerre deep south

customer_reviews.title: Finally he runs to the bowl
customer_reviews.text: I switched from blue buffalo.This food is higher in protein. My dog has no poop issues and they he gobbled the food up.. With all the other food tha tI have offered to him he hesitated to eat it. Sure he finally would eat it but it was not something that he would run to the bowl for. I know it is the freeze dried bits that have him coming to the bowl. .
customer_reviews.author: Michael Fassbender

customer_reviews.title: It's good stuff.
customer_reviews.text: I feed my dogs and cat only Merrick. It's good stuff. However this particular bag of kibble had no freeze-dried raw in it. 5 stars for Merrick, but only two for this bag. So, I am rounding it down to three.
customer_reviews.author: SVF

customer_reviews.title: Delicious and nutritious.
customer_reviews.text: Our dog has been eating Merrick for years and my husband bought this to spoil him. Our dog loves it and likes to pick out the raw bits first (think picking the marshmallows out of lucky charms) but continues to pace himself with the rest of the food so we don't have to regulate him. We'll probably switch to this for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: That's her favorite part of the food in her dish
customer_reviews.text: The most recent bag i received only had 3 (THREE) raw pieces in it. Very disappointing. Usually has at least 5-10% of the raw kibbles. My furry girl was unhappy as well. That's her favorite part of the food in her dish. She always eats them first.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy JJ

customer_reviews.title: Husky Friendly
customer_reviews.text: My Husky loves the food and she’s a picky eater. She always eats the freeze dried meat first.
customer_reviews.author: Mp369

customer_reviews.title: Not all bags are equal
customer_reviews.text: My dog enjoys this food. Quality control of the product as to how many pieces of the raw bits are in it is poor however. We have had 3 bags so far. One bag had very few freeze dried bites, the second bag had a few more, and the third bag had more. The packaging of this dog food is very disappointing , but the food is great.
customer_reviews.author: J B

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: The freeze dried pieces are a lot larger than I thought they'd be. There was only about 1 piece per cup. My dog tended to pick out the pieces as "treats" and ignore the rest of the food.
customer_reviews.author: Talia Wagner

customer_reviews.title: No
customer_reviews.text: Our boxer dog had only been on another brand but lost interest so decided to switch her food .. came across this and thought I would give a chance .. dog loved it but it made her sick .. gave her non stop diarrhea.. and I introduced her slowly to this food
customer_reviews.author: YNB

customer_reviews.title: Healthy for digs
customer_reviews.text: My dogs all LOVE this food, and they don’t even know it’s good for them!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Collins

customer_reviews.title: Good dog food
customer_reviews.text: My pom loves this food, and is working perfectly with him, it shows in his poop. Good consistency,color and odor, I'll recommend it to all. Good quality food, made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: maria l.

customer_reviews.title: My dogs 🐶 don't like it, and for the $ it's a waste of $
customer_reviews.text: My dogs pick the freeze dried pieces out and eat and throw the kibble on floor.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but may be worth it
customer_reviews.text: so far, this has been a pretty good food for our Rhodesian Ridgeback. No problems with gas, the price is more than I like to pay, but it is grain free and his digestive issues have not been affected by this food.
customer_reviews.author: Shannah O

customer_reviews.title: GRAIN FREE
customer_reviews.text: GREAT DRY FOOD FOR DOGS WITH ALLERGIES TO DYES AND FOOD COLORING!!! CAN'T RATE TASTE.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT F.

customer_reviews.title: Damaged goods
customer_reviews.text: Love the product but this is the second time I’ve ordered product from this company and the bag already slit open with kibble wasted all over.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: It used to have a way more freeze dried meat.
customer_reviews.text: Its gone down in quality and has way less actual meat pieces than it used to.
customer_reviews.author: Usathome

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: We switched to the backcountry from another Merrick product. Dogs liked both, but really ate up the backcountry flavors. Cost a little more, but worth it
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my American bully, got diareah for a long time, bought at my local pet store, problem solved. Even smells different than the fresh bag
customer_reviews.author: Norberto Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Grain free is a proven hazard to dogs
customer_reviews.text: Grain free is not good for dogs won’t be buying this again too many potatoes peas etc
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Gruhlke

customer_reviews.title: I will never buy this product again
customer_reviews.text: We are now up to the third bag of food where we have found pieces of what looks like whiskers or the bristles from a brush. It upsets me to no end to imagine how many kibbles my precious dog has eaten that contained that foreign object. I would not recommend this product. I only gave the one star because my canine enjoyed the dry freezed meat in the food.
customer_reviews.author: Marva

customer_reviews.title: Gracie my picky dog loves this
customer_reviews.text: Arrived early and I was almost completely out of dog food. My Gracie dog loves merricks dog food and she Is a picky eater. She loves this flavor the best. Highly reccommended
customer_reviews.author: Babie Cakes

customer_reviews.title: Merrick needs to be consistent with the kibble and freeze-dried raw meat ratio
customer_reviews.text: My dog likes this dry food, but only with the freeze-dried raw meat mixed in. The amount of freeze-dried raw meat is inconsistent. The last bag I purchased didn't have much. The best is when it's already crumbled up and mixed in really well, but that bag was purchased at Chewy.
customer_reviews.author: Liza Rapay

customer_reviews.title: Quality seems to be excellent. My two large dogs would eat the entire ...
customer_reviews.text: Quality seems to be excellent. My two large dogs would eat the entire bag if they could get their paws on it. Expensive so I will mix this with a little less expensive brand. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: April Showers

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves the raw part but...
customer_reviews.text: Once I let my dog switch over to this, he immediately eats the raw dried freeze pieces but leaves the rest of the dry food. He knows what he likes. It's too bad that he doesn't eat all the food. I was very hopeful that he would enjoy this more.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Maya loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several quality dog food brands. My boxer barely ate them. A friend told me to try Merrick. I bought some from Petco and she ate the whole bowl...I was stunned. Then I checked Amazon for the same food. It was $12.92 cheaper. Thanks again Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: scott westbrook

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves!
customer_reviews.text: Dog loves the freeze dried meat in here. Gobbles it down first, then eats the rest of the kibble. High quality food.
customer_reviews.author: Carey

customer_reviews.title: Great, Healthy dog food!!!
customer_reviews.text: My dog is very picky, would never eat dry dog food. My sister buys this food, so I asked her to let me try some for my dog. My dog loves it, especially the white tofu chunks, he eats those first.
customer_reviews.author: Rennee'

customer_reviews.title: 10 pieces of freeze dried meat!? :(
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and there were only about 10 pieces of freeze dried meat at the top of the bag. Very disappointed. I kept hoping there was more at the bottom of the bag but sadly no. I have bought before and there was a lot more meat pieces. I'm not sure I'll take a chance again. It is a lot of money to gamble on there being more more meat next time.
customer_reviews.author: Karen M.

customer_reviews.title: highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: Aside from my dog loving this food, it has improved her health. She kept vomiting at night and the vet didn't find anything alarming since the vomiting only happened once in a while. I read about similar cases online and I read about high protein foods helping dogs that had similar problems, apparently its lack of protein. Since I've fed her this food she hasn't vomited at all, highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Balcazar

customer_reviews.title: The first time I ordered, there were lots of ...
customer_reviews.text: The first time I ordered, there were lots of freeze dried bits. The second order had exactly zero. Unless there is more consistency in packaging, I don't plan to order this again.
customer_reviews.author: K D

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Not happy. Received the bag torn and taped. Will not be reordering this product VIA Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Gator Mom

customer_reviews.title: We normally love this product
customer_reviews.text: We normally love this product, but in this batch there was a snafu in the lot, and it was all kibble and no freeze dried chunks. We called Merrick, they snail mailed out two small bags of the chunks, which we had to then mix in, but no apology and it took longer than expected to get the shipment.
customer_reviews.author: Cam O. Lotwiz

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves this, particularly the freeze dried bits ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this, particularly the freeze dried bits. His coat appears more shiny since changing food about 9 months ago
customer_reviews.author: MQ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for sensitive stomachs
customer_reviews.text: Our dog alternates each month between two flavors of this dog food. Perfect grain free meal for our nugget.
customer_reviews.author: Jon H.

customer_reviews.title: Doggies loved the first time around and not as much the second time around.
customer_reviews.text: The first time I bought this product, my dogs ate it up like crazy and the second time I bought it, not so much. I am not sure why. The quality seemed really good and I always use Merrick products but they just weren't as crazy about it the second time around. And, because of that, I have had the same bag for a few months and that has caused the delicious freeze dried pieces to change texture. But...I am assuming that this is because it has been in tupperware container for too long. Merrick products are excellent and haven't had problems in the past. Will try again but only in small bag quantity.
customer_reviews.author: Robin C.

customer_reviews.title: I love the Merrick dog food
customer_reviews.text: I love the Merrick dog food. However, when it arrived yesterday, the shipping box was damaged. It looked like it was opened and tampered with, and re-taped with lots of tape. I will be inspecting the dog food packaging to make sure it was not tampered with as well..
customer_reviews.author: Susanne Rose Giannella

customer_reviews.title: Dog enjoys it
customer_reviews.text: Expensive, but my dog enjoys it everytime and is healthy so can't complain
customer_reviews.author: James Rowe

customer_reviews.title: First time trying this food, my dogs usually eat ...
customer_reviews.text: First time trying this food, my dogs usually eat Instinct (highly recommend). The bag of food I got smells rancid after a week in an airtight container. It doesn't expire until December 2018. One dog wasn't doing well on it right off the bat, but I figured there was something wrong with it when my other dog walked away from her full bowl. Wanted to put up a review just in case anyone else is having issues with this food.
customer_reviews.author: Michal

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love this dog food
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love this dog food. They pick out the raw chunks first when they are eating. There are lots of raw chunk per serving.
customer_reviews.author: cgold

product_meta.title: Merrick Backcountry Raw Infused Great Plains Red Meat Dry Dog Food
product_meta.description:
Style:Grain Free Original Recipe| Flavor Name:Great Plains Red Meat| Size:22 LB

Merrick Backcountry is an all-natural, grain free ancestral canine diet packed with protein that dogs crave. Merrick Backcountry Raw Infused kibble recipes deliver a perfect combination of protein-rich, grain free kibble plus real, whole pieces of raw, freeze-dried meat, poultry or fish. They provide your active dog the nutritional benefits of a raw diet they would have discovered in the wild, now in a safe and convenient recipe that's easy to serve.

Feeding Guide:

Goal Weight (lbs) Calories Per Day Cups Per Day (Approx) 3 139 1/3 cup 6 233 2/3 cup 10 342 1 cup 15 464 1-1/4 cups 20 575 1-1/2 cups 30 780 2 cups 40 968 2-1/2 cups 50 1144 3 cups 60 1312 3-1/4 cups 70 1472 3-2/3 cups 80 1627 4 cups 90 1778 4-1/2 cups 100 1924 4-3/4 cups
feature_bullets: Freeze-Dried Real Raw Meat Pieces To Lock In Fresh Taste
Grain-Free Nutrition With No Gluten Ingredients For Easier Digestibility
Recipe Is Rich With Omega Fatty Acids For Healthy Skin And Coat And Contains Leading Levels Of Glucosamine And Chondroitin For Healthy Hips And Joints
